# you-get-extra-information-2

## problem

![image](https://github.com/quasar098/ctf-writeups/assets/70716985/fe389d35-a57c-406f-b4ae-1d7ab1a42d4e)

see other files for more information

## solution

z3 is very overpowered

first, we can foil out the extra information equation to this weird looking thing `n**2*p**3 + 5*n**2*p**2 + 10*n**2*p + 5*n**2 + 5*n*q + q**2 == extra`

then, we use z3 to solve it

```py
import z3

solver = z3.Solver()

extra = 
n = 

p = z3.Int("p")
q = z3.Int("q")

solver.add(n**2*p**3 + 5*n**2*p**2 + 10*n**2*p + 5*n**2 + 5*n*q + q**2 == extra)
solver.add(p*q == n)

print(solver.check())
print('checked')
print(solver.model())
```

it takes quite a while, but we get p and q to be

```
sat
checked
[q = 7591285472030363593819309149475285775894683777302616308552541051471117604695830085885971123084425024738819800112718432254917427153283662301475561286492279,
 p = 12592515782077404137849236994955837609500154464782855076585955501637937872493619036975469814859697874798733737517472127306855726944300236711447248402640349]
```

then, we use p and q in RSA to decrypt

```
>>> q = 7591285472030363593819309149475285775894683777302616308552541051471117604695830085885971123084425024738819800112718432254917427153283662301475561286492279
>>> p = 12592515782077404137849236994955837609500154464782855076585955501637937872493619036975469814859697874798733737517472127306855726944300236711447248402640349
>>> n=q*p
>>> d=pow(65537, -1, (p-1)*(q-1))
>>> ct = 
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import *
>>> long_to_bytes(pow(ct, d, n))
b"amateursCTF{omg_it's_my_favorite_epic_thing_where_it_looks_like_a_binomial!!}"
>>>
```
